Comment: CO2 produced transporting food waste to AD plant.  Often reported as a financial cost for transport in interviews
Sources: Manor Farm,  Little Oak, MH, CbD
Big n Smart: Trucks travelling to large AD plants - could increase CO2, but may utilise biogas (Less GHGs & CO2 produced from landfill)  'Electrification has reduced demand for gas and transport fuel, and the remainder is met with biofuels. Demand has also reduced, thanks to extensive upgrades to UK housing and public transport'   **
Create n Cope: Less CO2 produced in transport processes. reduced (everything is more efficient in Big and Smart – we don’t want to oversell efficiency benefits, but this seems likely to offer some reduction in costs)   **
Share n Connect: Much less GHG production due to better use of waste (very little waste to landfill).  Stays the same. More actors in the system, therefore some natural inefficiencies, but they are very well connected, and committed to working carefully together to maximise efficacy of journeys. ***
WorkshopValidation: Discussed under Transportation of FW.  Validated - all agree on importance

Comment: AD has a Requirement for water, but less than other energy production methods
Area: Local, National  Regional  water stress higher in S England than Scotland / Wales
Big n Smart: High water demand and unpredictable supply. Grey water used where possible. Water is scarce, particularly in Southern regions.
Create n Cope: Moderate water demand but unpredictable supply. AD innovated to ensure decreased water demand than previous requirement.
Share n Connect: Demand lower than previously but still require effective water services. Water scarcity still a possibility, but managed well for most of the year, water quality has also improved.
WorkshopValidation: Validated at workshop. Most AD does not use very much water (feedstock often high liquid content) but mains water used for washing out equipment. Water req if crops grown for feedstock

Comment: Quality is important. Too much contamination is a big problem.
Big n Smart: FW utilised by bioenergy in large scale AD
Create n Cope: Not as much FW available due to high food values
Share n Connect: Less FW available due to local production
WorkshopValidation: Validated at workshop.  All stakeholders agreed

Comment: improves feedstock availability and the rate of other recyclables
Big n Smart: Org Waste became a more valuable resource, now processed (Large scale) for bioenergy and fertiliser production
Create n Cope: Less FW available, collected separately processed for animal feed or bioenergy
Share n Connect: Less FW available due to increased local production, but all waste separated and treated as valuable resource
WorkshopValidation: Validated at Workshop - Important to consider Quality. Decrease Contaminants.  Dependent on Policy

Comment: Usually a cost for disposal. Issues often related to perceived quality of the digestate (contamination)
DriverBarrier: D or B (usually a cost for disposal)
IncreaseDecrease: May change to be a driver over time. Depends on future scenario.
Big n Smart: Digestate produced at large scale, depends if demand available for it. Likely to utilise valorisation as well as AD
Create n Cope: less Digestate produced  due to high food values, but bioenergy demand high (supplemented with bioenergy crops/inedible waste). Demand is high, especially during dry spells.
Share n Connect: likely to utilise digestate as community will utilise non-avoidable FW for micro/small scaleAD Digestate more likely to be a driver as local market for it.  Smaller scale production – local use
WorkshopValidation: Validated: this is the indicator that seems very dependent on Policy. Need Digestate to be seen as a resource rather than byproduct to be disposed of.

Comment: Complicated marketplace
IncreaseDecrease: Increase Can be used to decarbonise electricity
Create n Cope: biogas production, but less infrastructure.  Used for vehicle fuel/local use
Share n Connect: small scale biogas production – used locally (eg café cooking)
WorkshopValidation: Validated at Workshop  Dependent on Policy

Comment: Use of heat from AD plants
Utilisation of energy from AD
Big n Smart: due to energy policy HGVs using biofuel. Better infrastructure in place to supple biogas to synergistic commercial enterprises
Share n Connect: Smaller scale AD providing biogas for off-grid heating/cooking at the local level.

Comment: Decreased when AD used Especially compared to slurry use. bioenergy generated from organic waste (AD)  as having “high greenhouse gas emission saving potential,”“signi?cant environmental advantages,”
Big n Smart: Less GHGs & CO2 produced from landfill
Create n Cope: Less CO2 produced in transport processes. More localised innovations decreasing GHG production
Share n Connect: Much less GHG production due to better use of waste (very little waste to landfill).

Comment: Resilience to drought with improved org matter
Big n Smart: Digestate readily available, restrictions apply on timing and frequency of application
Create n Cope: With more uncertain rainfall, more important to increase soil org matter to retain moisture.
Share n Connect: More likely to be beneficial at smaller scale so higher impact in Share’n’Connect. Availability from small scale AD at local level

Comment: Becomes an important indicator if crops grown for AD feedstock
Big n Smart: Becomes an important indicator, especially if crops grown for AD feedstock. Intensification may lead to decrease in biodiversity and increased water use
Create n Cope: Volatile climate increases risk,  making it more difficult for farmers to select the best crop for climate conditions. At the UK level co-operation, intensification innovation and diversification allow  land take to remain at a similar level.  Better use  is made of brownfield sites e.g. hydroppihonic / indoor growing methods as these are resistant to outdoor variaton in temp/rainfall etc.)
Share n Connect: Increased land use (but of ex-industrial land).  Large diversification has changed farming practices. More co-operative production

Comment: Investment needed to build the plant. ROI uncertain
Big n Smart: May decrease with investment from Germany & Japan for large scale plants
Create n Cope: More LA investment at all scales
Share n Connect: More communities invest in small scale AD drives price down
WorkshopValidation: Validated at Workshop   Dependent on Policy eg subsidies

Comment: Cost of maintaining production over the lifecycle
Big n Smart: May decrease with investment from Germany & Japan for large scale plants
Create n Cope: More LA investment at all scales
Share n Connect: More communities invest in small scale AD drives price down

Comment: Savings made from not sending waste to landfill
Food waste transportation to AD plant (see also Digestate Disposal which includes transport cost)
DriverBarrier: Driver (but may be a barrier to efficiency & innovation)
Big n Smart: Large scale AD requires significant transport, but sophisticated monitoring / management improves efficiency
Create n Cope: Increase in onsite renewable energy production. Decreases transport costs to some extent.
Share n Connect: community led AD reduces transport costs - more local

Comment: Driven by energy policy. Changes to RTFO means less focus on electricity production
IncreaseDecrease: (possibly driver, but only where local requirement)
WorkshopValidation: Validated at Workshop  Dependent on Policy

Comment: Expensive. Storage costs high, expensive to pay for contractors to remove.
Big n Smart: Increased demand for digestate alongside synergistic climate controlled food production utilising waste heat.  Costs decrease
Create n Cope: Increased demand for digestate (esp in drought conditions) drives up demand and decreases disposal costs
Share n Connect: Local level use from community level AD (less transport costs for digestate disposal).

Comment: Best way to decrease GHG emissions and make use of the food resource
Big n Smart: Data driven industry decreases commercial FW
Create n Cope: Increased demand due to volatile food market prices and increased transport costs
Share n Connect: Less demand due to more community level food programmes/shared kitchens

Comment: Often negative perception, issue of increased traffic in rural areas.
Sources: Little Oak, Manor Farm, Surrey Council, ADBA, TM, Backcasting Notes, London Workshop
IncreaseDecrease: (many, but not all AD operators had issues with planning)
Big n Smart: Increased population size and spread of cities makes it harder to locate large AD plants away from  populated areas. Numbers adversely affected likely to increase
Create n Cope: More farm led AD due to need to diversify. Increases the number of people negatively affected.
Share n Connect: Small scale, co-owned AD plants become more commonplace and more acceptable within the community as people recognise the benefits

Comment: Health, Decreased                                            smell (cf slurry).  May have odour issues of AD esp from waste storage
IncreaseDecrease: Issues usually of perception of AD.

Comment: Rural diversification/ avoidance depopulation
Employment from Waste Resource use
Better education helps lead to more sustainable resource use
Shared expertise increases similar innovation activity (Cluster effect)
Pasteurisation kills pathogens.  Biosecurity issues from waste exist, hence need for regs.
Change in regulations problematic. Costs, compliance, complexity. Complying with regulations can be a large percentage of set up costs for AD (30% MB TM)
Cluster' effect of innovations such as AD
Less reliance on fossil fuel and foreign supply chains  Improving the spread of energy sources
Emerging area, products such as bioplastics, pharmaceuticals
Big n Smart: Unavoidable waste used to produce high value products. Byproduct can then got to AD to produce energy

Comment: Could be lucrative if it becomes acceptable
Big n Smart: Consumption of insect protein more acceptable, much larger market for products
Create n Cope: Consumption of insect protein more acceptable, much larger market for products
Share n Connect: Consumption increasing but less than other scenarios

Comment: Digestate more difficult to use than inorganic, but can help improve soil structure (esp if fibrous material used). Regs exist on use
Big n Smart: Still widespread NPK use in Big’n’smart

Comment: Idea of carbon tax credits / targets
